entry.title: she likes a boy (i am a boy)
entry.summary:
Author: eddiebodywantsbuck

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,234Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 2

Summary: When Buck heard other people talk about their gender identity and expression, he felt an overwhelming sense of confusion, envy, even anger. Knowing most people feel at home in their bodies, was an ever-present source of discomfort. To be forced into conformity, wear a dress, put on makeup, your breasts are growing- try on this bra. It was uncomfortable, anxiety-inducing and just… wrong. Buck didn’t have a name for it until he was fourteen years old. Transgender. He had felt this presence his entire childhood, every time he attempted another dangerous stunt, got another injury to fit in with the boys in his class. There was an ever-growing discomfort, an overwhelming sense of confusion, and a hatred inside him. Buck turned to pain to cope, a way of numbing himself from the dysphoria that consumed him. Pain could be controlled, pain would mean his parents would pay him attention even for a minute. Pain was worth the blood, the cuts, the broken bones. Pain could be fixed. The only pain that couldn’t be fixed, is what tormented you on the inside.

entry.title: The Roof is on Fire

Author: Anonymous

Summary: Without Eddie’s knowledge, Captain Hawkins and a few of the firefighters he met at the competition teamed up to bid on him at a Bachelor Auction charity fundraiser. entry.title: chris diaz, matchmaker extraordinaire
entry.summary:
Author: madforyou

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,469Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 173

Summary: The kid claps a hand over his mouth. His eyes are huge and sparkling with something that looks like excitement or mischief, probably both. "Sorry, sorry," he whispers loudly. Then he leans forward, like he's about to share a secret. "You're a hunk, right?" Buck chokes on nothing. "I. What?" "A hunk," the kid repeats. "You know, a hunk." "I..." Buck has no idea what's happening. "Sure? I guess? I mean, I've been told... I work out sometimes—" "Perfect!" The kid is already digging around in his backpack. He pulls out a slightly crumpled rectangle of cardstock and presents it to Buck with great ceremony. "This is for you." It's a handmade card written in crayon, blue crayon. The handwriting is careful but wobbly, the letters all different sizes. My dad likes boys and is single. He is a HERO and fights fires like Superman. He is a hunk. If intrested, please contact Chris Diaz. Or,Christopher's fix-it kit for lonely dads.

entry.title: You could be mine
entry.summary:
Author: Whatdawnknows

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,325Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 106

Summary: “You don’t want to date any women.” Buck repeats what Eddie said, processing. “Do you want to date… men?” It’s out of his mouth before he can stop it. Eddie’s still not looking at him, staring at the wall, the empty bottles on the coffee table. His expression is somewhere between defeated and pained. “Buck...” he sighs. He runs his hands through his hair, lets it flop back onto his forehead. When he finally brings his eyes up to meet Buck’s, there’s something resolute there. Pointed. “I want to date A man.”   OR: Eddie comes over to Buck’s after the throuple debacle. They talk. And stuff.

entry.title: Two Lines Means Positive, Right?
entry.summary:
Author: James_Madison_617

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 114,288Chapters: 14/15Kudos: 399

Summary: Buck has four big problems in his life right now. Most people might scoff or say, “You don’t even know how hard life gets,” when a teenager complains about their life, but he feels justified in this. Junior year was kicking his ass, and he wasn’t looking forward to his senior year at all, especially if it’s anything like this. Every day of his life feels like a losing battle with everything going on around him and he was just so tired. The first would be high school, the workload making him stay up night after night and exhaust himself to get good enough grades to appease his parents. The second would be the previously mentioned parents who were on his ass about everything he did, constantly comparing him to how they think his brother would have turned out. The third issue was the fact that he was a trans man, another thing his parents disapproved of. The last and most pressing problem he was facing was the positive pregnancy test on his bathroom counter. Or,When Buck got pregnant as a teen and kept his child a secret from the 118 for years and how they found out.

entry.title: What a night to forget.
entry.summary:
Author: Absolute_Maniac

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,019Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 29

Summary: “Hey, can you see my phone anywhere?” he asked. Eddie started looking around the bed and then stretched himself to his side of the bed and pulled it from the nightstand. “Here.” He tossed it to him, and Buck immediately started looking through recent pictures on his phone. Pictures of them partying, a video of Eddie taking a shot, and another video of Eddie dancing. Then he came across the next picture and felt as if someone had thrown a bucket of ice water over his head. They must have asked someone else to take the picture because it was taken from at least a two-meter distance. The two of them were holding out a piece of paper towards the camera… and they were pressed together in a passionate kiss. Buck looked up from the picture when Eddie made a strangled sound on the other side of the room. “You might want to see this…” He reached over with a piece of paper in his hand. Buck took it and turned his phone over to him in return. Eddie bit into his fist as he studied the picture. Buck looked down at the paper in his hand and turned it over to the right side. It was a copy of a marriage license for Mr. Evan Buckley-Diaz and Mr. Edmundo Buckley-Diaz.

entry.title: I know they're losing (and I'll pay for my place by the ring)
entry.summary:
Author: funnyfeelingbuckley

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 48,837Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 61

Summary: It started as an outlet, at first. A way to let out his anger in a controlled manner, with a willing opponent who would offer him the pain that he deserved. He felt itchy. Teen pregnancy in a Catholic household had cloaked him with such a thick layer of shame that he needed a way to forget. It was a good thing, he tells himself. It was an honest thing - born out of good intentions. Until it wasn't. - Or Instead of enlisting in the military, Eddie makes money via an underground fight club in Texas. After threats against his family are leveled, Eddie finds a way to Los Angeles with the help of Athena Grant. Now working as private security, he begins working for Evan "Buck" Buckley, an arrogant and hot-headed singer/songwriter who may just give Eddie Diaz a run for his money.   title based on I Bet On Losing Dogs by Mitski

entry.title: the jackpot question
entry.summary:
Author: joe_mimah

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,495Chapters: 1/4Kudos: 3

Summary: The first time Buck ever broke his arm as a kid, Maddie offered, not quite unkindly, to pinch his leg each time he complained. “How would that help me?” Buck had whined. “It would distract you, at least for a little bit,” Maddie had explained, her older-sister’s ‘duh’ unsaid, but not unheard. And Maddie hadn’t really been serious, then, but Buck had laid in bed every night, his good arm pinching the hell out of his thigh, waiting for the pain to go away.   Twenty years later, he leans into Eddie.   or; the dam breaks over the holidays.

entry.title: The Family he made
entry.summary:
Author: AliciaSteinke15

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 235,123Chapters: 63/?Kudos: 961

Summary: When Buck left the Navy Seals he went to Chicago and became a firefighter. While in Chicago, Buck started at FireHouse 51 where he met Kelly Severide and fell in love with him. Two years after asking out Severide, Andy Darden dies and Kelly gets hurt and goes off the deep end but they get through it. A lot happened Buck and Kelly got married but when Shay dies everything changes. Kelly goes off the deep end again but it's worse this time. Buck tries to help but Kelly keeps pushing him away so one day Buck goes to Cheif Wallace Boden and asked to be transferred to another station in LA. When he tells Kelly to see if he will stop him, he doesn't. Kelly lets the love of his life and husband walk out the door with his wedding ring in Kelly's hand. When Buck gets to LA he joins FireHouse 118 and changes himself.This is the Story of how Evan "Buck" Buckley-Severide became Evan "Buck" Buckley
